body_html:
As a workaround (in virtualenv), we can use python 3.5 as below.

virtualenv --system-site-packages -p /usr/bin/python3.5 ~/tensorflow/

>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> hello = tf.constant('Hello, TensorFlow!')
>>> sess = tf.Session()
body_text:
As a workaround (in virtualenv), we can use python 3.5 as below.
virtualenv --system-site-packages -p  /usr/bin/python3.5 ~/tensorflow/
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> hello = tf.constant('Hello, TensorFlow!')
>>> sess = tf.Session()
body:
As a workaround (in virtualenv), we can use python 3.5 as below.

**virtualenv --system-site-packages -p  /usr/bin/python3.5 ~/tensorflow/**

```
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> hello = tf.constant('Hello, TensorFlow!')
>>> sess = tf.Session()
```
